newsitem.title: FRANCE: Eurotunnel banks to get just under 49 pct - paper.
newsitem.headline: Eurotunnel banks to get just under 49 pct - paper.

text.p: Eurotunnel is expected to announce on Monday that its banks will convert two billion stg of their nine billion stg loans into equity in the troubled group at a little above its suspension price last week of 9.5 francs per share, the Financial Times reported.

The newspaper said the 225 creditor banks will get slightly less than 49 percent control of the group as a result of the conversion of both cash and bonds in the deal which will be unveiled to shareholders on Monday.

Much of the rest of the outstanding debt will be converted into a range of financial instruments designed to reduce Eurotunnel's crippling interest bill and some of the instruments will run as long as 40 years to maturity, the newspaper said.
The reported refinancing deal comes after the company and it banks reached an agreement on Tuesday last week.
Eurotunnel is to hold a news conference in Paris and London on Monday to outline its financial restructuring plan.
The newspaper said the plan would allow shareholders to receive dividends within 10 years.
